FuncDef: The reset patch-configure command clears the patch configuration for the next AP startup.
CLIs: reset patch-configure next-startup { { ap-id { <startapid> [ to <endapid> ] } &<1-10> } | all-ap }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a start AP ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8191.

Specifies an end AP ID. An end AP ID cannot be less than a start AP ID.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8192.

Clears the patch configuration for the next startup of all APs.
-

Clears the patch configuration for the next AP startup.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After running the startup-patch command to configure a patch file for the next startup, you can run the reset patch-configure command to clear the configuration.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
After the reset patch-configure command is run, the patch file for the next AP startup is empty. After the AP restarts, it does not automatically install or run the patch file.
